stakeholder_balance.assessment: Slightly favors business over user needs

oracle_problems.title: User Convenience vs. Business Information Control
oracle_problems.description: Minimal information presentation (department names only, no search/filters) may be deliberate business decision to force page exploration, conflicting with user need for efficient task completion

stakeholder_perspectives.users: Want minimal clicks to find specific programs/departments (2-3 clicks ideal)
stakeholder_perspectives.business_marketing: May want higher page views, longer session times for engagement metrics
stakeholder_perspectives.business_admissions: Needs qualified applications, values conversion over engagement

evidence: No search on pages with 20+ items
Minimal information forcing users to click through
Simple list layouts vs information-rich cards

resolution_options.description: Implement search and rich listings, track quality metrics (applications, inquiries) instead of vanity metrics
Full transparency with search, filters, detailed info upfront
Maintain current approach, risk losing frustrated users to competitors

impact.user_impact: High frustration, 8-12 min task times, abandonment
impact.business_impact: Lost applications from frustrated users outweigh engagement metric gains
impact.net_assessment: Current state is lose-lose (poor UX + lost conversions)

oracle_problems.recommendation: Conduct stakeholder alignment session with Marketing, Admissions, and UX representatives. Present data showing correlation between search functionality and application conversion rates.

oracle_problems.title: International Audience vs. Primary Language Content
oracle_problems.description: 12% international students from 90 nationalities, yet language switcher not prominently visible and English content parity unknown. Unclear institutional priority.

stakeholder_perspectives.international_students: Expect full English content, easy language switching, culturally adapted experience
stakeholder_perspectives.administration: May prioritize domestic student recruitment (88% of student body)
stakeholder_perspectives.internationalization_office: Needs strong international recruitment to meet strategic goals

unclear_quality_criteria: What percentage of content must be available in English?
Should English be equal priority or secondary?
Is international growth a strategic priority or nice-to-have?

resolution_required.executive_decision: Is international growth a strategic priority?
resolution_required.if_yes: English must be equal priority (full parity, prominent switching, international-first design)
resolution_required.if_no: Set realistic expectations, don't market heavily to international students

business_impact.current_ambiguity: Lost international applications from confused/frustrated users
business_impact.clear_strategy: Either successfully recruit internationally OR focus resources on domestic market

oracle_problems.recommendation: Escalate to executive leadership for strategic clarity. Once decision is made, align website experience accordingly.

oracle_problems.title: Information Architecture vs. Academic Structure
oracle_problems.description: University organized by departments/schools, but prospective students think in terms of programs/careers, not organizational units

stakeholder_perspectives.users_prospective_students: Think by program name, career outcomes, subjects
stakeholder_perspectives.faculty_departments: Organized by academic disciplines and organizational structure

evidence: Navigation appears to follow organizational structure
Departments listed without context of programs offered
Unknown if program-first navigation option exists

conflict.academic_structure: Correct, reflects how university is actually organized
conflict.user_mental_model: Programs they want to study, careers they want to pursue
conflict.current_site: Forces users to learn organizational structure to find programs

resolution_options.description: Browse by Program (user mental model) + Browse by Department (academic structure)
Prioritize program discovery, downplay departmental structure
Force users to learn organizational structure

oracle_problems.recommendation: Implement dual navigation. User research should determine which is primary (likely program-first for prospective students).

oracle_problems.title: Conversion Optimization vs. User Autonomy
oracle_problems.description: Admissions office likely pressured to increase applications, which could lead to aggressive conversion tactics vs. user need for research autonomy

stakeholder_perspectives.admissions_office: Needs application volume to meet enrollment targets
stakeholder_perspectives.users: Want to research thoroughly, compare options, not feel pressured

potential_dark_patterns_risk: Excessive CTAs that distract from content
missing_information: Unable to assess current CTA density and pressure
Unknown if information is gated behind forms
quality_criteria_needed: What is acceptable application conversion rate?
Is quality of applicants more important than quantity?
Should international vs domestic students have different experiences?

resolution_options.description: Clear CTAs without pressure, full information transparency, respect user research process
Multiple CTAs, urgency messaging, gated content

oracle_problems.recommendation: Measure application quality (acceptance rate, enrollment rate, student success) not just application volume.

critical_issues.title: No Site-Wide Search Functionality
critical_issues.business_impact: Lost applications from frustrated prospective students
critical_issues.evidence: No search functionality or filtering mechanisms visible on analyzed pages
critical_issues.user_frustration: Users with specific queries face excessive navigation
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement prominent header search with autocomplete and scoped search (courses, faculty, research, news)
critical_issues.expected_outcome: 60% reduction in task completion time, 20% reduction in bounce rate

critical_issues.title: Language Switcher Not Visible
critical_issues.evidence: Language switcher not visible in extracted markup
critical_issues.user_frustration: International users may not discover English content exists
critical_issues.recommendation: Place language switcher in top-right header, persistent across pages, with flags + text labels

critical_issues.title: No Filtering on 20+ Item Pages
critical_issues.evidence: No search functionality or filtering mechanisms on departments page with 20 institutions
critical_issues.user_scenario: International student seeking Computer Science must read all 20 department names
critical_issues.recommendation: Add alphabet jump links, search filter, or categorization

critical_issues.title: Value Proposition Unknown
critical_issues.issue: Unable to identify homepage value proposition or hero messaging
critical_issues.benchmark: Homepage hero should answer: What does university excel at? Why study here? What outcomes?
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement clear value prop above fold with key differentiators
critical_issues.expected_outcome: Improved understanding, emotional connection, reduced bounce rate

critical_issues.title: Application CTA Visibility Unknown
critical_issues.issue: Unable to locate Apply Now buttons in analysis
critical_issues.benchmark: CTA should be visible on homepage above fold, every program page, navigation menu
critical_issues.high_risk_scenario: User finds perfect program, cannot find application button, abandons site
critical_issues.recommendation: Audit CTA placement and visibility, ensure above-fold on all program pages

critical_issues.title: Accessibility Concerns with Lime Color
critical_issues.issue: Lime (#94D500) on white may fail WCAG AA contrast ratio (4.5:1 for normal text)
critical_issues.testing_required: Verify all color combinations meet WCAG 2.1 AA
critical_issues.recommendation: Darken lime to #7AB600 or use only for decorative elements

high_priority_issues.title: Minimal Descriptive Content on Listings
high_priority_issues.issue: Only department/school name and link shown, no descriptions
high_priority_issues.cognitive_load: Forces users to hold information in working memory across multiple pages
high_priority_issues.recommendation: Add 2-3 sentence descriptions per department including focus areas, program count, research strengths
high_priority_issues.expected_outcome: Informed decisions without excessive clicking, reduced cognitive load

high_priority_issues.title: Navigation Depth Exceeds Optimal Levels
high_priority_issues.issue: Information likely buried 3-4+ clicks deep for key user tasks
high_priority_issues.user_impact: Cognitive overload, increased bounce rate, user frustration
high_priority_issues.evidence: Complex academic structure (16 departments, 4 schools, 193 programs) without simplified navigation
high_priority_issues.recommendation: Implement mega-menu with visual categorization and search-ahead functionality

high_priority_issues.title: Hero Image Fixed Height on Mobile
high_priority_issues.issue: 400px hero height likely covers 60-80% of mobile viewport
high_priority_issues.user_frustration: This page is just an image - must scroll immediately to see content
high_priority_issues.recommendation: Reduce hero to 250px or 40vh on mobile

high_priority_issues.title: International-Specific Information Unclear
high_priority_issues.business_impact: International applicants may not find critical information, abandon application
high_priority_issues.recommendation: Create dedicated International Students section with pre-arrival checklist, visa guidance, housing, testimonials

high_priority_issues.title: Program Language of Instruction Clarity
high_priority_issues.issue: Unknown if course listings clearly indicate language of instruction
high_priority_issues.critical_risk: International students may apply to Portuguese-taught programs unintentionally
high_priority_issues.recommendation: Add language badge to all program listings (icons for English/Portuguese)

pain_points.title: Course Discovery Friction
pain_points.issue: No search or filtering on course pages with 85+ masters programs
pain_points.user_quote_assumed: I just want to find Computer Science masters... why do I have to scroll through every program?
pain_points.frequency: Affects 100% of prospective students searching for specific programs

pain_points.title: Navigation Depth and Complexity
pain_points.user_frustration: I'm lost in this site... where am I?

pain_points.title: Minimal Contextual Information
pain_points.issue: Department listings show only names, no descriptions
pain_points.user_frustration: What does this department actually do? I have to click to find out?
pain_points.frequency: Affects 100% of users on department pages

pain_points.title: Language Switcher Discoverability
pain_points.user_frustration: This site is all in Portuguese... I guess they don't accept international students
pain_points.frequency: Affects 100% of international visitors landing on Portuguese page
recommendations: Place language switcher in top-right header (P0)

pain_points.title: Application Path Unclear
pain_points.issue: Application process and CTA visibility unknown
pain_points.user_frustration: I found the perfect program, but how do I apply?
pain_points.frequency: Affects 100% of users ready to apply
recommendations: Ensure Apply Now visible above fold on all program pages (P0)

p0_critical.title: Site-Wide Search Implementation
p0_critical.business_value: Enable fast course/dept discovery for all users
p0_critical.user_impact: Reduce task time from 8-12 min to 2-3 min

p0_critical.title: Language Switcher Visibility
p0_critical.user_impact: Enable 12% international audience to find English content

p0_critical.title: Application CTA Audit and Enhancement
p0_critical.user_impact: Clear path to application for qualified users
implementation: Audit current CTA visibility on all pages
Add Apply Now to homepage (above fold), every program page (sticky), navigation menu
Create How to Apply explainer page

p0_critical.title: Course/Program Filtering and Search
implementation: Add multi-faceted filters (level, department, language, mode)

p0_critical.title: Mega-Menu Navigation
p0_critical.user_impact: See all options at once, understand site structure

gui_flow_changes.description: New header search box with autocomplete dropdown

performance.current: React SPA may have large initial bundle
performance.mitigation: Lazy load images, code splitting, WebP format
performance.net_impact: +5-8% page load time if not optimized, neutral if optimized

recommendations_impact.contact_forms: Must validate and sanitize inputs (XSS risk)

security.mitigation: Input validation, CSP headers, privacy-compliant chat provider

recommendations_impact.search: Improve keyboard navigation, screen reader access
recommendations_impact.mega_menu: Risk if not implemented accessibly (keyboard traps)

accessibility.mitigation: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance for all new features

positive: Reduced phone inquiries about basic info
negative: May need more staff to handle increased applications
Expectation of faster response times (live chat)
May push back on information transparency

neutral: May need to create new content (country-specific guides, testimonials)

positive: FAQ and chatbot reduce basic inquiry volume
negative: Chat widget requires staffing during business hours

immediate_actions_2_weeks.details: Task scenarios, mobile/desktop testing, document current state with screenshots, measure task times
Present oracle problems, align on strategic priorities, get executive buy-in
Technical feasibility assessment, resource allocation, implementation roadmap
Fix page title redundancy, ensure language switcher visible, audit application CTAs, add contact links

month_3_optimization: Visual design consistency audit and fixes

persona_driven_experience: Personalized landing pages by user type
long_term_vision_6_12_months.goal: Move from 68/100 (C) to 85+/100 (A) - Top-tier university website experience

limitations: Unable to access rendered page content (CSS/JS returned instead of HTML)
No heat maps or session recordings
Some assessments based on reasonable assumptions
No competitive benchmarking against peer institutions

confidence_levels.high_confidence_0.85_1.0: Issues identified directly from available data
confidence_levels.medium_confidence_0.7_0.84: Issues inferred from partial data and common patterns
